meanings.definition: A prefix added to the beginning of a word.
meanings.sent1: The superfix 'un-' changes the meaning of the word.
meanings.sent2: In English, 'un-' is a common superfix.
meanings.sent3: I learned about the superfix 'un-' in school today.
meanings.sent4: The superfix 'un-' is like a small addition that makes a big difference.
meanings.sent5: Remember, a superfix comes before the root word.

meanings.definition: To fix or attach something above or on top of something else.
meanings.sent1: Please superfix the sign to the wall.
meanings.sent2: He used glue to superfix the broken pieces together.
meanings.sent3: I superfix my favorite picture above my bed.
meanings.sent4: Her smile superfixes any bad mood I may have.
meanings.sent5: The stars seem to superfix themselves in the night sky.
